en: The ruling party has secured 50 seats as of 5 o'clock.
zh: 截至五点，执政党已获得50个席位。

en: Party leaders are hammering out a proposal for political reform.
zh: 党的领导人正在敲定一项政治改革方案。

en: I've nothing to give.
zh: 我没有什么可以给的。

en: Minds that have nothing to confer find little to perceive.
zh: 没有东西可以交流的思想，也很难感知到什么。

en: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
zh: 施比受更有福。

en: It's necessary for you to make the best use of your time.
zh: 你有必要充分利用你的时间。

en: You should put aside some money when you can afford to.
zh: 你应该在负担得起的时候存一些钱。

en: We have no spare money.

en: We have no extra money.
zh: 我们没有额外的钱。

en: We don't have any extra money.
zh: 我们没有任何额外的钱。

en: We have plenty of time to spare.
zh: 我们有充足的时间。

en: We have time to spare.
zh: 我们有空余时间。

en: I want to spend rest of the life pursuing my ideals.
zh: 我想用余生追求我的理想。

en: The extra effort raised his blood pressure above normal.
zh: 额外的努力使他的血压高于正常水平。

en: Go about your business.

en: None of your business.
zh: 不关你的事。

en: It's none of your business!

en: Attend to your own business.
zh: 管好你自己的事。

en: Try to utilize your leisure for reading.
zh: 尽量利用你的闲暇时间阅读。

en: Try to make good use of your spare time.
zh: 尽量好好利用你的空闲时间。

en: What's your favorite pastime?

en: Make the best of your time.
zh: 充分利用你的时间。

en: Leisure has been viewed as a means to an end.
zh: 休闲一直被视为达到目的的一种手段。

en: You needn't worry too much.

en: Don't eat too much.
zh: 不要吃太多。

en: I didn't enjoy it very much.
zh: 我不太喜欢。

en: They consider it impolite to disagree with someone they don't know very well.
zh: 他们认为不同意不太熟悉的人的意见是不礼貌的。

en: I'm afraid it's not a good idea.
zh: 恐怕这不是个好主意。

en: Too many people are indifferent to politics.
zh: 太多人对政治漠不关心。

en: The reservation number is 1003.
zh: 预订号码是1003。

en: Are there reserved seats on the train?

en: All subscriptions must be paid before the end of this year.
zh: 所有订阅必须在今年年底前支付。

en: The reservation desk, please.

en: Please tell the reservation clerk, Mr Ichiro Takahashi, your credit card number to confirm your reservation.
zh: 请将您的信用卡号码告知预订员高桥一郎先生，以确认您的预订。

en: Could you cancel my reservation?

en: In order to get a reservation, you must use her name.

en: Can I make a reservation?

en: I'd like to change my reservation from three to five nights.
zh: 我想把我的预订从三晚改为五晚。

en: I'm going to leave one night early.

en: I'm going to leave one night earlier than I had planned to.
zh: 我要比原计划提前一晚离开。

en: I'm going to leave one day early.

en: I'm going to leave one day earlier than I had planned to.
zh: 我要比原计划提前一天离开。

en: I'd like to change my reservation for three to five nights.
zh: 我想把我的预订从三晚改为五晚。

en: All the seats are sold in advance.

en: I have a confirmed reservation.

en: Could I make a reservation?
zh: 我可以预订吗？

en: Do you have an appointment?

en: If you can't come on the day of your appointment, be sure to let us know by the previous day.
zh: 如果您无法在预约当天前来，请务必提前一天告知我们。

zh: 请告诉我您预订房间时收到的确认号码。

en: Do I need to reconfirm?

en: We'd like to confirm our reservations.

en: Your reservation is reconfirmed.

en: Hey you, make a reservation.

en: I'd like to reconfirm my flight.
zh: 我想重新确认我的航班。

en: Can you fix me a reservation?

en: I have a reservation.

en: I'd like to make a reservation.
zh: 我想预订。

en: I've got to get some shots.
zh: 我得去打几针。

en: Defensive driving can help you avoid accidents.
zh: 防御性驾驶可以帮助你避免事故。

en: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.

en: Prevention is much preferable to cure.
zh: 预防远胜于治疗。

en: Preventive measures are much more effective than the actual treatment.
zh: 预防措施比实际治疗更有效。

en: The prediction was for more snow.

en: They forecast it will be cloudy tomorrow.

en: I need an extra blanket.

en: Please give me a spare blanket.
zh: 请给我一条备用毯子。

en: It snowed as was forecast.

en: I need an extra pillow.

en: I'll visit you on Sunday, if I don't write you to the contrary.
zh: 如果我没有写信告诉你，我将在星期天拜访你。

en: I'll check my schedule.
zh: 我会查看我的日程安排。

en: I'm expecting my baby in the middle of January.
zh: 我预计一月中旬会生宝宝。

en: Could you tell me the ETA?

en: Right on schedule, that contractor came around today, begging for more time.
zh: 完全按计划进行，那个承包商今天又来了，恳求更多时间。

en: It's behind schedule.
zh: 它落后于计划了。

en: I'm running behind schedule.

en: It's ahead of schedule.

en: We landed at Narita a little behind schedule.
zh: 我们降落在成田机场时稍微晚点了。

en: The schedule must be maintained.
zh: 必须维持进度。

en: People were bewildered by the unexpected situation.
zh: 人们对这意想不到的情况感到困惑。

en: There were more spectators than I had expected.
zh: 观众比我预期的要多。

en: This bad weather is more than I bargained for.

en: They were spoiled, as might have been expected.
zh: 他们被宠坏了，正如人们可能预料到的那样。

en: As was expected, they lost the contest.
zh: 正如预期的那样，他们输掉了比赛。

en: You may as well begin to prepare your lessons.
zh: 你最好开始准备你的课程。

en: The budget passed the Upper House.
zh: 预算案在上议院通过了。

en: I reviewed the budget, and decided to cut costs.
zh: 我审查了预算，并决定削减成本。

en: The budget appears to be inaccurate and unrealistic.
zh: 这份预算似乎不准确且不切实际。

en: The budget must be balanced.

en: We must find the money, Madam Chairman, for the sake of the children.

en: How much would you want to pay for the tour?

en: The budget was narrowly approved by Congress.

en: A budget is a plan or schedule adjusting expenses during a certain period to the estimated or fixed income for that period.
zh: 预算是在一定时期内调整支出的计划或时间表，以适应该时期的估计或固定收入。

en: We ran over the budget by two thousand yen.
zh: 我们的预算超支了两千日元。

en: We should provide for unexpected events.

en: Since unexpected incidents occurred one after another, the exhibition was called off.

en: Some unexpected difficulties have arisen.

en: An unexpected result came about.
zh: 出现了一个意想不到的结果。

en: I regret that I will be unable to meet you on February 27 owing to an unexpected matter.
zh: 我很遗憾，由于突发事件，我无法在2月27日与您见面。

en: I was caught in a shower and got drenched to the skin.

en: I was caught in an evening shower.

en: In the evening, I walk with my dog.

en: I take a walk with my dog in the evening.
zh: 晚上我遛狗。

en: It came to rain toward evening.

en: It came on to rain toward evening.
zh: 傍晚开始下雨了。

en: Drop by my office this evening.
zh: 今晚来我的办公室一趟。

en: She will have finished her job by evening.
zh: 到晚上她会完成她的工作。

en: By evening the shadow of the tree reached the wall.

en: I help my mother in the evening.

en: It's five in the evening.

en: Is there a flight in the evening?

en: What does she do in the evening?

en: Moderate exercise in the evening helps induce sleep.

en: It may snow in the evening.

en: It looks like snow toward evening.

en: It seems like it will snow in the evening.

en: It looks like it's going to snow tonight.

en: Evening is drawing on.
zh: 夜幕降临了。

en: Evening was drawing near.
zh: 傍晚临近了。

en: The travelers made haste as evening drew near.

en: It said rain from this evening.
zh: 预报说从今天晚上开始有雨。

en: It began to rain toward evening.

en: It began to rain in the evening.
zh: 晚上开始下雨了。

en: People gather around here when it gets dark.

en: Evening was closing in on the valley.
zh: 傍晚降临山谷。

en: The telephone rang while I was having supper.

en: Have you had dinner?

en: Hurry in for supper.

en: It's time for dinner.

en: It's supper time.

en: Supper is ready.

en: Let me pay for the dinner.

en: Shall I fix you supper?

en: Shall I cook dinner for you?

en: I'll go out after having dinner.

en: I'd like to have dinner with you.

en: She cooked the dinner herself.

en: How long will it be to dinner?

en: It seems that supper will be late.

en: Are you going to have dinner at home?

en: What time do you have supper?

en: At what time is dinner served?

en: What time is supper?

en: What time will dinner be served?

en: I don't want dinner.

en: Are you ready for dinner?

en: Dinner is ready, so we can eat whenever we want.

en: The dinner is almost ready.

en: Dinner is almost ready.
zh: 晚饭快好了。

en: Dinner's almost ready.
zh: 晚饭快好了。

en: I wonder if dinner is ready.

en: It is now dinner time, and flight attendants begin to serve dinner.
zh: 现在是晚餐时间，空乘人员开始提供晚餐。

en: After dinner, we played cards till eleven.
zh: 晚饭后，我们玩牌玩到十一点。

en: You can watch TV after supper.
zh: 你吃完晚饭后可以看电视。

en: After dinner, we all went into the drawing room.
zh: 晚饭后，我们都去了客厅。

en: May I invite you to dinner?

en: I'm glad to be invited to dinner.
zh: 我很高兴被邀请参加晚餐。

en: How about going out for dinner?
zh: 出去吃晚餐怎么样？

en: Would you like to come over to our house for dinner?
zh: 你愿意来我们家吃晚餐吗？

en: All the family meet at evening meals.
zh: 全家人在晚餐时见面。

en: I'll prepare sashimi for dinner.
zh: 我准备晚餐做生鱼片。

en: Thank you for inviting me to dinner.
zh: 谢谢你邀请我吃晚餐。

en: Do you have guests for dinner?

en: I know a good place for dinner.
zh: 我知道一个吃晚餐的好地方。

en: Let's have dinner.
zh: 我们一起吃晚餐吧。

en: Let's eat supper.
zh: 我们吃晚饭吧。

en: Let's eat dinner.
zh: 我们吃晚餐吧。

en: I don't care where we eat dinner. It's entirely up to you.
zh: 我不在乎我们在哪里吃晚餐。完全由你决定。

en: After dinner, a movie announcement is made.
zh: 晚餐后，发布了一个电影预告。

en: Dinner finished, they enjoyed playing cards.
zh: 晚餐结束后，他们愉快地玩纸牌。

en: After dinner, they enjoyed playing cards.
zh: 晚餐后，他们愉快地玩纸牌。

en: Dinner's ready.
zh: 晚餐准备好了。

en: Dinner is ready!
zh: 晚餐准备好了！

en: Dinner's ready!
zh: 晚餐准备好了！

en: Supper was laid out on the table.
zh: 晚餐已经摆在桌子上了。

en: When dinner was over, we adjourned to the sitting room.
zh: 晚餐结束后，我们转移到起居室。

en: After he finished supper, he began to read the novel.
zh: 他吃完晚饭后，开始读小说。

en: The sunset glows in the west.
zh: 夕阳在西方闪耀。

en: An evening glow often promises good weather.
zh: 晚霞通常预示着好天气。

en: We may well have rain this evening.
zh: 今晚很可能会下雨。

en: The tower looks beautiful against the evening sky.

en: The twilight merged into darkness.
zh: 暮色融入了黑暗之中。

en: Dusk fell over the desert.
zh: 黄昏降临在沙漠上。

en: His house was broken into last night.
zh: 他家昨晚被盗了。

en: Last night his father passed away because of his illness.
zh: 昨晚他父亲因病去世了。

en: I stayed up late last night.
zh: 我昨晚熬夜了。

en: It snowed a good deal last night.
zh: 昨晚下了很大的雪。

en: It frosted last night.
zh: 昨晚结霜了。

en: Did you call me last night?
zh: 你昨晚给我打电话了吗？

en: Last night you forgot to turn off the radio, didn't you?
zh: 昨晚你忘了关收音机，是吧？

en: I sat up all last night reading a novel.
zh: 我昨晚熬夜看了一整晚的小说。

en: I stayed up late last night reading a novel.
zh: 我昨晚熬夜看小说了。

en: Last night I could not do my homework on account of a long blackout.
zh: 昨晚因为长时间停电，我没能做作业。

en: The moon was bright last night.
zh: 昨晚月亮很亮。

en: It froze hard last night.
zh: 昨晚结了厚厚的冰。

en: I did not sleep at all last night.
zh: 我昨晚完全没睡。

en: I didn't sleep at all last night.
zh: 我昨晚完全没睡。

en: I slept so well last night.
zh: 我昨晚睡得很好。

en: I slept very well last night.
zh: 我昨晚睡得非常好。

en: I slept soundly last night.
zh: 我昨晚睡得很香。

en: It wasn't very hot last night.
zh: 昨晚不是很热。

en: There wasn't much news in last night's newspaper.
zh: 昨晚的报纸上没什么新闻。

en: Was it you that left the door open last night?

en: I had a date with Jane last night.
zh: 我昨晚和简约会了。

en: I have had a slight headache since last night.
zh: 从昨晚开始我一直有点头疼。

en: I've had a slight headache since last night.
zh: 我从昨晚开始就有点头疼。

en: I passed by your house about 10 last night.
zh: 我昨晚10点左右路过你家。

en: I had a slight headache last night.
zh: 我昨晚有点头疼。

en: Speech is silver, silence is gold.
zh: 雄辩是银，沉默是金。

en: Speech is silver, silence is golden.
zh: 雄辩是银，沉默是金。

en: The eloquent scholar readily participated in the debate.
zh: 那位口才流利的学者欣然参加了辩论。

en: The male peacock has colorful tail feathers.
zh: 雄孔雀有色彩鲜艳的尾羽。

en: What will the postage be?

en: The mail carrier delivers mail from door to door.
zh: 邮递员挨家挨户地送信。

en: The second the mailman comes, he rushes out to pick up his mail.
zh: 邮递员一来，他就冲出去取邮件。

en: It is funny that the mailman hasn't come yet.
zh: 邮递员还没来，真奇怪。

en: The mailman comes around every three days.
zh: 邮递员大约每三天来一次。

en: The postman was bitten by that dog.
zh: 邮递员被那条狗咬了。

en: Would you mind giving me a ride to the post office?
zh: 你能顺便送我去邮局吗？

en: I've just been to the post office.
zh: 我刚去过邮局。

en: Please tell me the way to the post office.

en: Can you direct me to the post office?
zh: 你能告诉我邮局怎么走吗？

en: The post office is half a mile away.

en: The mail arrives before noon.

en: Please address your mail clearly and correctly.

en: Don't come to school just for fun.

en: Don't come to school to lark around.

en: Business before pleasure.

en: It would be difficult to improve the device when there is no effective catalyst.

en: I believe in ghosts.

en: Ghosts exist.

en: You can't be too careful in choosing your friends.

en: Do you have many friends?

en: You cannot be too careful in choosing friends.

zh: 交朋友容易，维持友谊难。

en: I have just been to the airport to see my friend off.

en: Some have come to meet their friends and others to see theirs off.
zh: 有些人来接朋友，有些人来送朋友。

en: I've been to the station to meet a friend.

en: My friend departed from Narita for Paris.

en: I have few friends.

en: I have a few friends.

en: Friends should help one another.

en: My friend is opposed to my opinion.

zh: 我的一个朋友向我展示了他从国外买的所有娃娃。

en: My friend got good marks in the English examination.
zh: 我的朋友在英语考试中得了好成绩。

en: My friend wants a car of his own.
zh: 我的朋友想要一辆属于自己的车。

zh: 我的朋友摇了摇头，好像在说“不可能”。

en: You should be careful in your choice of friends.
zh: 你在选择朋友时应该小心。

zh: 我特意去拜访我的朋友，但他不在家。

en: He took delight in talking with friends.

zh: 我的一个朋友昨晚给我打电话了。

en: There is nothing so important as friendship.
zh: 没有什么比友谊更重要的了。

en: There is nothing as important as friendship.
zh: 没有什么比友谊更重要的了。

en: Nothing is so valuable as friendship.
zh: 没有什么比友谊更珍贵。

en: Friendship consists of mutual understanding.
zh: 友谊在于相互理解。

en: Friendship is more precious than anything else.
zh: 友谊比任何东西都珍贵。

en: Friendship is the most precious of all.
zh: 友谊是最珍贵的。

en: Friendship is a plant which must be often watered.
zh: 友谊是一棵需要经常浇灌的植物。

en: Friendship bound them together.
zh: 友谊将他们紧密联系在一起。

en: It goes without saying that friendship is more important than business.
zh: 不用说，友谊比生意更重要。

en: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
zh: 拥有朋友的唯一方法是成为朋友。

en: It is true that we cannot be too careful choosing our friends.
zh: 的确，我们在选择朋友时再小心也不为过。

en: Have patience with a friend rather than lose him forever.
zh: 宁愿对朋友有耐心，也不要永远失去他。

en: He will take on the responsibility for his friends.
zh: 他会承担起对他朋友的责任。

en: My friend Sun shine on me now and ever.
zh: 我的朋友，阳光永远照耀着我。

en: Even a child knows what it is like to be without friends.
zh: 即使是孩子也知道没有朋友是什么滋味。

en: None but the brave deserve our respect.
zh: 只有勇敢者才值得我们尊敬。

en: Pay honor to the brave.
zh: 向勇敢者致敬。

en: None but the brave deserve the fair.
zh: 只有勇敢者才能赢得美人芳心。

en: Summon up your courage and tell the truth.
zh: 鼓起勇气，说出真相。

en: Keep a good heart and go on writing.
zh: 保持一颗善良的心，继续写作。

en: Face adversity with courage.
zh: 勇敢地面对逆境。

en: Keep up your courage.
zh: 保持勇气。

en: Have the courage to save our earth.
zh: 要有拯救地球的勇气。

en: Courage is required of everyone.
zh: 每个人都需要勇气。

en: There is no way out of the siege except to take the bull by the horns and let God judge the outcome.
zh: 除了抓住问题的关键，让上帝来评判结果，没有其他办法可以摆脱困境。

en: Who can read the heroic deeds of brave men without a feeling of respect and admiration?
zh: 谁能读到勇敢者的英雄事迹而不感到敬佩和钦佩呢？

en: Bravery is a great virtue.
zh: 勇敢是一种伟大的美德。

en: Being less urgent, this plan is lower in priority.
zh: 由于不那么紧急，这个计划的优先级较低。

en: Not being able to decide what the priority should be is the biggest problem.
zh: 无法决定优先事项是什么是最大的问题。

en: It's far from winning the first prize.
zh: 离获得一等奖还差得远呢。

en: Congratulations on the victory!
zh: 祝贺你获胜！

en: When will Yuko come to Denver?
zh: 由香何时来丹佛？

en: The value of a good education cannot be measured in terms of money.
zh: 良好教育的价值无法用金钱衡量。

en: Even a good computer cannot beat you at chess.
zh: 即使是好的电脑也无法在象棋上击败你。

en: The gentle-looking old man got up and gave his hand to me.
zh: 那位看起来很和蔼的老人站起来，向我伸出了手。

en: He is kind.
zh: 他很善良。

en: He's a kind person.
zh: 他是个善良的人。

en: She's a kind person.
zh: 她是个善良的人。

en: Explain it in plain words.
zh: 用简单的话解释一下。

en: The only useful knowledge is that which teaches us how to seek what is good and avoid what is evil.
zh: 唯一有用的知识是教我们如何寻求善，避免恶的知识。

en: Your only remedy is to go to the law.
zh: 你唯一的补救办法就是诉诸法律。

en: The rapid increase of imports surprised us.
zh: 进口的迅速增长让我们感到惊讶。

en: Many efforts have been make to develop market for imports.
zh: 人们已经做出了许多努力来开发进口市场。

en: Import goods are subject to high taxes.
zh: 进口商品要缴纳高额税款。

en: I think they should put a heavy tax on imports.
zh: 我认为他们应该对进口商品征收重税。

en: Import restrictions are barriers to closer relations between the two countries.
zh: 进口限制是两国之间更紧密关系的障碍。

en: Imported cars account for less than eight percent.
zh: 进口汽车占不到百分之八。

en: Imported cars are in strong demand.
zh: 进口汽车需求旺盛。

en: Import restrictions have been greatly loosened of late.
zh: 近来，进口限制已经大大放宽。

en: Multilateral trade negotiations ran aground over import quotas.
zh: 多边贸易谈判因进口配额问题而搁浅。

en: The demand was brought down by increases in imports.
zh: 进口的增加导致需求下降。

en: The strengthening of competitiveness on export markets is an urgent need.
zh: 加强出口市场的竞争力是一项迫切的需求。

en: The export business isn't doing well.
zh: 出口业务不太景气。

en: Exporting is a commercial activity which transcends borders.
zh: 出口是一种超越国界的商业活动。

en: The exports increased by 30 billion dollars.
zh: 出口额增加了三百亿美元。

en: A blood transfusion is necessary.
zh: 需要输血。

en: Security is the greatest enemy.
zh: 安全是最大的敌人。

en: Plenty of opportunities will present themselves, if only you are awake to them.
zh: 只要你留心，就会有很多机会出现。

en: You'd better stay on your guard.
zh: 你最好保持警惕。

en: Oil paintings show to advantage at a distance.
zh: 油画远看效果更好。

en: Keep oil away from the fire.
zh: 让油远离火。

en: Oil floats on water.
zh: 油浮在水面上。

en: Oil and water won't blend with each other.
zh: 油和水不会混合在一起。

en: Oil does not mix with water.
zh: 油和水不混合。

en: Oil and water don't mix.
zh: 油和水不混合。

en: You cannot mix oil and water.
zh: 油和水是不能混合的。

en: You can't mix oil and water.
zh: 油和水是不能混合的。

en: Oil and water don't blend.
zh: 油和水不会混合。

en: I don't like a fat diet.
zh: 我不喜欢高脂肪饮食。

en: Oil is running short.
zh: 石油快用完了。

en: Have fun this summer!
zh: 祝你今年夏天玩得开心！

en: Oaks may fall when reeds stand the storm.
zh: 当芦苇经受住风暴时，橡树可能会倒下。（比喻：柔能克刚）

en: Willow branches don't break under the weight of snow.
zh: 柳枝在雪的重压下不会折断。（比喻：柔韧性强）

en: A fox isn't caught twice in the same snare.
zh: 狐狸不会在同一个陷阱里被抓住两次。（比喻：吃一堑，长一智）

en: Compare the translation with the original.
zh: 将翻译与原文进行比较。

en: You should keep the medicine box away from your child.
zh: 你应该把药箱放在孩子拿不到的地方。

en: It is very hot here in summer.
zh: 这里夏天很热。

en: It is very hot here in the summer.
zh: 这里夏天很热。

en: It's really hot here in the summer.
zh: 这里夏天真热。

en: The pharmacist made up the prescription for me.
zh: 药剂师为我配好了药。

en: Until what time does your pharmacy stay open?
zh: 你们药房营业到几点？

en: We'll give your pharmacy a call.
zh: 我们会给你们药房打电话。

en: Take this prescription to your pharmacy.
zh: 把这个处方拿到你的药房去。

en: The kettle must be boiling.
zh: 水壶一定快开了。

en: The kettle is boiling.
zh: 水壶开了。

en: The kettle is steaming.
zh: 水壶在冒蒸汽。

en: The kettle is whistling on the stove.
zh: 水壶在炉子上发出鸣叫声。

en: Wait till the kettle begins to sing.
zh: 等到水壶开始唱歌。

en: The drugstore is at the end of this road.
zh: 药店就在这条路的尽头。

en: When taking drugs, follow the directions on the bottle carefully.
zh: 服药时，请仔细按照瓶子上的说明进行。

en: Keep the medicine away from children.
zh: 把药放在儿童接触不到的地方。

en: Princess, don't drink the potion.
zh: 公主，别喝药水。

en: I believe more in diet than in drugs.
zh: 我更相信饮食，而不是药物。

en: The medicine acted on his stomach.
zh: 这药刺激了他的胃。

en: Keep all medicines out of reach of children.
zh: 把所有药物放在儿童接触不到的地方。

en: Put the medicine where children can't get at it.
zh: 把药放在孩子们拿不到的地方。

en: Medicine should be out of the way of children.
zh: 药物应该放在儿童接触不到的地方。

en: Drugs should be used only at the direction of a doctor.
zh: 药物只能在医生的指导下使用。

en: Where can I get the medicine?
zh: 我在哪里可以买到药？

en: The effect of the drug had worn off.
zh: 药效已经过去了。

en: Let me write you a prescription for some medicine.
zh: 我给你开些药吧。

en: I will find out how the medicine works.
zh: 我会弄清楚这种药是如何起作用的。

en: The effects of the medicine were wearing off.
zh: 药效正在减退。

en: Please explain how to take the medicine.
zh: 请解释一下如何服用这种药。

en: Some medicines will do you more harm than good.
zh: 有些药对你弊大于利。

en: Are you allergic to any medicine?
zh: 你对什么药过敏吗？

en: I'm allergic to some medicine.
zh: 我对一些药过敏。

en: You can't rely on medicine alone if you want to get well.
zh: 如果你想康复，不能只依赖药物。

en: If the medicine is abused, people can ruin their health.
zh: 如果滥用药物，人们会毁掉自己的健康。

en: The medicine cured him of his illness.
zh: 这种药治好了他的病。

en: The medicine has worked.
zh: 药起作用了。

en: The medicine had no effect.
zh: 这药没起作用。

en: Come back again when you finish your medicine.
zh: 吃完药再来复诊。

en: Your medicine is ready.
zh: 你的药准备好了。

en: He has a drug allergy.
zh: 他对药物过敏。

en: Don't go back on your promise.
zh: 不要食言。

en: It wasn't very discreet of you to forget the appointment.
zh: 你忘记约会很不谨慎。

en: We must not forget our promise.
zh: 我们不能忘记我们的承诺。

en: A man who breaks his promises cannot be trusted.
zh: 一个不守信用的人是不可信任的。

en: Those who often break their promises are never trusted.
zh: 那些经常违背诺言的人永远不会被信任。

en: It is not good to break a promise.
zh: 违背诺言是不好的。

en: You ought not to break your promise.
zh: 你不应该违背你的诺言。

en: You shouldn't break your promises.
zh: 你不应该违背你的诺言。

en: It is irresponsible of you to break your promise.
zh: 你违背诺言是不负责任的。

en: It was irresponsible of him to break a promise.
zh: 他违背诺言是不负责任的。

en: Nothing offends people worse than broken promises.
zh: 没有什么比违背诺言更让人恼火的了。

en: You should not break your promise.
zh: 你不应该违背你的诺言。

en: We must not break our promise.
zh: 我们不能违背我们的诺言。

en: You must bind yourself to keep the promise.
zh: 你必须约束自己信守承诺。

en: You must promise to keep your promise.
zh: 你一定要保证遵守你的承诺。

en: You must swear to keep your promise.
zh: 你必须发誓遵守你的承诺。

en: Forgive me for breaking my promise.
zh: 请原谅我违背了我的承诺。

en: I think it important that we keep our promise.
zh: 我认为我们遵守承诺很重要。

en: I think it's important to keep promises.
zh: 我认为遵守承诺很重要。

en: It is very important to keep your word.
zh: 信守诺言非常重要。

en: You must keep your promise.
zh: 你必须遵守你的承诺。

en: Many politicians fail to keep their word.
zh: 许多政客未能信守诺言。

en: Many politicians don't keep their promises.
zh: 许多政客不遵守他们的承诺。

en: There are many politicians who don't keep their promises.
zh: 有很多政客不遵守他们的承诺。

en: It is a shame not to keep your promise.
zh: 不遵守承诺是很可耻的。

en: If you don't keep your promises, people won't take you seriously.
zh: 如果你不遵守你的承诺，人们不会认真对待你。

en: I want you to keep your promise.
zh: 我希望你遵守你的承诺。

en: You will keep your word, won't you?
zh: 你会信守诺言的，对吧？

en: It is thoughtful of you to remind me of my promise.
zh: 你提醒我我的承诺，你真周到。

en: Could I change my appointment to 10:30 a.m.?
zh: 我可以把我的预约改到上午十点半吗？

en: It was noticed after more than a month that that promise had not been carried out.
zh: 一个多月后才发现那个承诺没有兑现。

en: I realized one month had passed without my making good my promise.
zh: 我意识到一个月过去了，我却没有兑现我的承诺。

en: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
zh: 如果你做出承诺，你应该遵守它。

en: A promise is a promise.
zh: 承诺就是承诺。

en: A deal is a deal.
zh: 一言为定。

en: Promises are made to be broken.
zh: 承诺就是用来打破的。(This is a literal translation, but in Chinese, it's less common to say this directly. You might instead say something like "承诺常常被打破" - Promises are often broken)

en: Promises are things that must be kept.
zh: 承诺是必须遵守的东西。

en: Promises should be kept.
zh: 承诺应该被遵守。

en: You ought to keep your promise.
zh: 你应该遵守你的承诺。

en: Keep your word; otherwise you'll end up losing face.
zh: 说话要算数，否则你会丢面子的。

en: One must keep one's promises.
zh: 人一定要遵守承诺。

en: You may as well keep your promise.
zh: 你最好还是遵守你的承诺。

en: One should keep one's promises.
zh: 人应该遵守承诺。

en: You should keep your promises.
zh: 你应该遵守你的承诺。

en: You should come through with your promise.
zh: 你应该兑现你的承诺。

en: You should carry out your promises.
zh: 你应该履行你的承诺。

en: You should deliver on your promises.
zh: 你应该兑现你的承诺。

en: You should fulfill your promises.
zh: 你应该履行你的承诺。

en: You should make good on your promises.
zh: 你应该兑现你的承诺。

en: The appointed day is close at hand.
zh: 约定的日子快到了。

en: Be sure to come here by the appointed time.
zh: 务必在约定的时间来这里。

en: Don't fail to come here by the appointed time.
zh: 请务必在约定的时间来这里。

en: Always come by the time promised.
zh: 总是要在约定的时间来。

en: Do not fail to come here by the appointed time.
zh: 请务必在约定的时间来这里。

en: I was late for the appointment.
zh: 我赴约迟到了。

en: I took a bus so as not to be late for my appointment.
zh: 我为了不赴约迟到，所以坐了公交车。

en: I took a bus so I wouldn't be late for my appointment.
zh: 我为了不赴约迟到，所以坐了公交车。

en: I took a taxi so that I would be in time for the appointment.
zh: 我为了能准时赴约，所以坐了出租车。

en: You must be faithful to your word.
zh: 你一定要信守诺言。

en: We must avoid calling on others without an appointment.
zh: 我们必须避免不预约就拜访别人。

en: She played the piano as promised.
zh: 她如约弹了钢琴。

en: It is one thing to promise, and another to perform.
zh: 承诺是一回事，履行又是另一回事。

en: You should visit him by appointment.
zh: 你应该预约拜访他。

en: I must remind you of your promise.
zh: 我必须提醒你你的承诺。

en: About two weeks.
zh: 大约两周。

en: Approximately two weeks.
zh: 大约两周。

en: About an hour's walk brought us to the lake.
zh: 步行大约一个小时，我们到达了湖边。

en: It's about one month.
zh: 大约一个月。

en: Some officials may have been corrupted.
zh: 可能有一些官员被腐败了。

en: It's a sop to Cerberus.
zh: 这是一种息事宁人的做法。

en: An actor has to memorize his lines.
zh: 演员必须记住他的台词。

en: An executive council was formed to discuss the new proposal.
zh: 成立了一个执行委员会来讨论新的提案。

en: The directors were reluctant to undertake so risky a venture.
zh: 董事们不愿意承担如此冒险的事业。

en: An essential condition for a helpful interview is a quiet room in which doctor and parents can sit comfortably and in private without being interrupted.
zh: 一个有益的访谈的必要条件是一个安静的房间，医生和父母可以在其中舒适地、私下地坐着，不受打扰。

en: Leave out anything that is useless.
zh: 去掉任何无用的东西。

en: Put aside all those which are useless.
zh: 把所有无用的东西都放在一边。

en: There is a black sheep in every flock.
zh: 每个群体中都有一只害群之马。

en: It's a difficult matter.
zh: 这是一件棘手的事情。

en: Troublemakers rarely become model citizens.
zh: 惹麻烦的人很少成为模范公民。

en: The arrow indicates the way to Tokyo.
zh: 箭头指示着去东京的路。

en: The arrow indicates the way to go.
zh: 箭头指示着前进的方向。

en: The arrow glanced off the tree.
zh: 箭擦过了树。

en: The arrow fell short of the target.
zh: 箭没有射中目标。

en: The arrow hit the target.
zh: 箭射中了目标。

en: The arrow went home.
zh: 箭射回家了。(This translation is a bit figurative and depends on context. A more literal translation would be "箭射回了原处" but it sounds unnatural.)

en: Let them all come.
zh: 让他们都来吧。

en: The arrow pierced the thick board.
zh: 箭穿透了厚木板。

en: It causes quite a sensation when Nomo pitches a no-hitter.
zh: 野茂投出无安打比赛时，引起了很大的轰动。

en: Ambition drove him to murder.
zh: 野心驱使他去谋杀。

en: The savage robbed me of my precious jewels and ran away.
zh: 那个野蛮人抢走了我珍贵的珠宝并逃走了。

en: The opposition party is still harping on the scandal.
zh: 反对党还在喋喋不休地谈论这起丑闻。

en: The opposition party put forward a bill to reduce income tax.
zh: 反对党提出了一项降低所得税的法案。

en: Bird watching is a nice hobby.
zh: 观鸟是一个不错的爱好。

en: Watching wild birds is great fun.
zh: 观察野生鸟类非常有趣。

en: Watching wild birds is a lot of fun.
zh: 观察野生鸟类非常有趣。

en: I am watching wild birds.
zh: 我正在观察野生鸟类。

en: Please help me welcome Mr. Nomura.
zh: 请帮助我欢迎野村先生。

en: Wild animals live in the jungle.
zh: 野生动物生活在丛林中。

en: Wild animals roamed across the plains.
zh: 野生动物在平原上漫游。

en: No wild tigers are to be found in Africa.
zh: 在非洲找不到野生老虎。

en: I like studying wild flowers.
zh: 我喜欢研究野花。

en: A lot of reports came to the policeman that a wild monkey was found.
zh: 警察接到很多报告，说发现了一只野猴子。

en: Although ambitions are well worth having, they are not to be achieved easily.
zh: 虽然有雄心壮志是值得的，但它们不容易实现。

en: Ambition is one of his characteristics.
zh: 雄心是他的性格特征之一。

en: Wild animals live in the forest.
zh: 野生动物生活在森林里。

en: The fielder failed to catch the ball.
zh: 外野手没能接住球。

en: Hills and fields cloaked in spring colors.
zh: 山丘和原野披上了春天的色彩。

en: The price of vegetables varies from day to day.
zh: 蔬菜的价格每天都在变化。

en: Eat a lot of vegetables.
zh: 多吃蔬菜。

en: The prices of vegetables are down.
zh: 蔬菜的价格下降了。

en: Some children do not like vegetables.
zh: 有些孩子不喜欢蔬菜。

en: What do you think about vegetable tempura?
zh: 你觉得蔬菜天妇罗怎么样？

en: It is most important to chew your food, whether vegetable or meat, before you swallow it.
zh: 最重要的是在吞咽食物之前咀嚼食物，无论是蔬菜还是肉类。

en: The field is covered with snow.
zh: 田野被雪覆盖着。

en: Hideyo Noguchi was a great man.
zh: 野口英世是个伟大的人。

en: Dr. Hideo Noguchi died in Africa in 1928.
zh: 野口英世博士于1928年在非洲去世。

en: A big tree in the field was struck by lightning.

en: I found the problem easier than I had expected.
zh: 我发现这个问题比我预期的要容易。

en: I appreciate your problem, but it can't be helped.
zh: 我理解你的问题，但这是没办法的事。

en: The problem is that Nancy doesn't go to the club meetings.
zh: 问题是南希不去俱乐部开会。

en: The question is which to choose.
zh: 问题是选择哪个。

en: The problem was where to set up the tent.
zh: 问题是把帐篷搭在哪里。

en: The problem was where to eat lunch.
zh: 问题是去哪里吃午饭。

en: The question is where to buy the book.
zh: 问题是在哪里买这本书。

en: The question is how we will bell the cat.
zh: 问题是我们如何给猫系铃铛。

en: The question is how will we deal with this difficult situation.
zh: 问题是我们将如何处理这个棘手的情况。

en: The problem is who is going to tell him the truth.
zh: 问题是谁去告诉他真相。

en: The point is that mother is not very hard on the child.
zh: 重点是妈妈对孩子不是很严厉。

en: The question is this: who called her on the phone?
zh: 问题是：谁给她打了电话？

en: The question is this.
zh: 问题是这个。

en: The trouble is that we have no money.
zh: 麻烦的是我们没钱了。

en: The question is when to start.
zh: 问题是什么时候开始。

en: The problem is how to raise the funds.
zh: 问题是如何筹集资金。

en: The problem is how we cope with the present difficulties.
zh: 问题是我们如何应对当前的困难。

en: The problem is that solar energy costs too much.
zh: 问题是太阳能成本太高了。

en: The question is how to say no without making them angry.
zh: 问题在于如何拒绝才不会让他们生气。

en: The question is how we can raise the money.
zh: 问题在于我们如何才能筹集到这笔钱。

en: The question is not so much what it is as how it looks.
zh: 问题不在于它是什么，而在于它看起来怎么样。

en: The problem lies in the fact that the necessary gap is bridged by perception.
zh: 问题在于必要的差距是由感知来弥补的。

en: The question is how to avoid nuclear war.
zh: 问题在于如何避免核战争。

en: Some test questions are unfair to gorillas.
zh: 有些考题对大猩猩不公平。

en: The person in question is now staying in America.
zh: 所说的那个人现在住在美国。

en: The root of the problem is a lack of communication between departments.
zh: 问题的根源在于部门之间缺乏沟通。

en: Sleeping on a problem solves it as easily as pouring oil on troubled waters.
zh: 对问题置之不理，问题就会像火上浇油一样变得更糟。

en: The point at issue is not her ability but her character.
zh: 争论的焦点不是她的能力，而是她的人品。

en: The question is whether he will come on time.
zh: 问题是他是否会准时来。

en: It is not what you read but how you read that matters.
zh: 重要的不是你读什么，而是你如何读。

en: The problem is Mr. Bark, the man whose secretary is away.
zh: 问题在于巴克先生，就是那位秘书不在的先生。

en: No problem!
zh: 没问题！

en: No prob.
zh: 没问题。

en: No problem.
zh: 没问题。

en: It is not her ability, but her character that is at issue.
zh: 问题不在于她的能力，而在于她的人品。

en: With regard to the matter in question, I will write to you in detail later.
zh: 关于所讨论的事情，我稍后会详细地写信给你。

en: The determining factor in question is whether this social welfare plan can facilitate the influx of immigrants.
zh: 所讨论的决定性因素是这项社会福利计划是否会促进移民涌入。

en: It's not his ability, but his character that is at issue.
zh: 问题不在于他的能力，而在于他的人品。

en: Is something wrong?
zh: 有什么不对劲吗？

en: What's the matter?
zh: 怎么了？

en: It's a problem.
zh: 这是个问题。

en: That's a problem.
zh: 那是个问题。

en: Upon inquiring, I learned that she was out.
zh: 一问之下，我才知道她出去了。

en: I will have him call you the moment he gets back.
zh: 他一回来，我就让他给你打电话。

en: I'll return to get my handbag.
zh: 我回去拿我的手提包。

en: When I got back, my bag had disappeared without a trace.
zh: 我回来的时候，我的包不见了，消失得无影无踪。

en: I'll look it over after I come back.
zh: 我回来后会仔细检查一下。

en: He said on his return, "It has been a wonderful tour."
zh: 他回来后说：“这是一次很棒的旅行。”

en: A specialist has his own strength.
zh: 专家有他自己的优势。

en: Every man to his trade.
zh: 三百六十行，行行出状元。

en: We took it for granted that she would take part in the speech contest.
zh: 我们认为她参加演讲比赛是理所当然的。

en: Don't give yourself airs.
zh: 不要自命不凡。

en: I'd like to buy eye drops.
zh: 我想买眼药水。

en: She differs from the others in that she has a goal.
zh: 她与众不同之处在于她有目标。

en: We played catch to achieve the goal.
zh: 我们玩投接球是为了达到目标。

en: I found it difficult to achieve my purpose.
zh: 我发现很难实现我的目的。

en: It looked tough to achieve his aim.
zh: 看起来他很难实现他的目标。

en: The end does not necessarily justify the means.
zh: 结果并不一定能证明手段的正当性。

en: Does the end justify the means?
zh: 为了达到目的，可以不择手段吗？

en: Granting that the aim is right, how will you carry out the plan?
zh: 就算目标是正确的，你打算如何执行这个计划？

en: The end does not always justify the means.
zh: 结果并不总是能证明手段的正当性。

en: Kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
zh: 杀鸡取卵。

en: The impending examination loomed large in her mind.
zh: 即将到来的考试在她脑海中挥之不去。

en: You must not think about your immediate profit only.
zh: 你不能只考虑眼前的利益。

en: You must be polite to your elders.
zh: 你必须对长辈有礼貌。

en: I awoke to find myself in a strange room.
zh: 我醒来发现自己在一个陌生的房间里。

en: She woke to find herself in the hospital.
zh: 她醒来发现自己在医院里。

en: I opened my eyes to find myself on a sofa.
zh: 我睁开眼睛，发现自己躺在沙发上。
